Sugar-Free Sponge Cake

Jump to Recipe

Are you searching for a delicious dessert that fits your healthy lifestyle? Look no further! This Sugar-Free Sponge Cake is not only light and airy but also made with wholesome ingredients that won't derail your dietary goals. Perfect for those who are cutting back on sugar, this sponge cake utilizes unsweetened applesauce and almond flour to create a treat that is both satisfying and guilt-free. Whether you want to impress your guests at a gathering or enjoy a sweet slice with your afternoon tea, this cake is versatile enough to serve on any occasion. Follow our simple recipe to whip up this delightful cake in no time, and indulge in a slice of sweetness without the added sugar!

Ingredients

eggs

Use large eggs for best results. If you're vegan or allergic, you can substitute 1 egg with 1/4 cup of unsweetened applesauce or 1/4 cup of silken tofu blended until smooth.

baking powder

Ensure your baking powder is fresh for optimal rise. If you're out, you can substitute with 1/4 teaspoon of baking soda and 1/2 teaspoon of vinegar or lemon juice.

almond flour

Almond flour adds moisture and a nutty flavor. If you need a nut-free option, you can substitute with oat flour or a gluten-free all-purpose flour blend, but the texture may vary.

unsweetened applesauce

This acts as a natural sweetener and moisture provider. If you don't have it, you can replace it with mashed bananas or Greek yogurt, keeping in mind that it will alter the flavor slightly.

vanilla extract

Use pure vanilla extract for the best flavor. If you don’t have it, you can use vanilla bean paste or a few drops of vanilla essence, but avoid imitation vanilla as it may affect the taste.

salt

Salt is crucial for enhancing flavor. If you're watching sodium intake, you can reduce it to a pinch, but don’t omit it entirely as it balances the sweetness.

butter (melted)

Melted butter gives richness. You can substitute with coconut oil or a dairy-free margarine for a dairy-free version. If you're avoiding fats, consider using unsweetened yogurt or applesauce but the texture may change.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Oven

    Set your oven to 350°F (175°C). This is crucial to ensure your cake bakes evenly and rises properly.

  • Step 2: Prepare the Cake Pan

    Grease an 8-inch round cake pan with butter or non-stick spray to prevent the cake from sticking.

  • Step 3: Beat the Eggs

    In a large mixing bowl, use a whisk or an electric mixer to beat 4 eggs until frothy. This incorporates air into the eggs, which helps the cake rise.

  • Step 4: Mix Wet Ingredients

    Add 1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce, 2 tablespoons melted butter, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract to the beaten eggs. Mix well until fully combined.

  • Step 5: Combine Dry Ingredients

    In a separate bowl, combine 1 cup almond flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, and 1/4 teaspoon salt. This ensures even distribution of the leavening agent.

  • Step 6: Fold Dry Into Wet Mixture

    Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture. Use a spatula to gently fold until just combined. Be careful not to overmix, as this can make the cake dense.

  • Step 7: Prepare for Baking

    Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth the top with the spatula to ensure even baking.

  • Step 8: Bake the Cake

    Place the cake in the preheated oven and bake for 25-30 minutes. Check doneness by inserting a toothpick into the center; it should come out clean.

  • Step 9: Cool the Cake

    Once baked, let the cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Then, transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely. This prevents sogginess from steam.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I know when to stop beating the eggs?

Beat the eggs until they are frothy and slightly increased in volume, which usually takes about 2-3 minutes with a hand mixer. You're looking for a light and airy texture that will help your cake rise.

Can I use other types of flour instead of almond flour?

Yes, but keep in mind that using a different flour will change the texture and taste of the cake. If you want to substitute, try using coconut flour or a gluten-free all-purpose blend, but adjust the liquid as needed since these flours absorb more moisture.

What can I use instead of unsweetened applesauce?

You can substitute mashed bananas or pureed pumpkin for the applesauce. They will add their own flavor, so choose one that complements the cake.

How do I properly grease the cake pan?

Use a paper towel or a pastry brush to spread a thin layer of butter or cooking spray over the bottom and sides of the pan to prevent sticking. You can also dust it lightly with almond flour for extra assurance.

What should I do if my cake is not rising?

Ensure your baking powder is fresh and hasn't expired, as this is crucial for leavening. Also, be careful not to overmix the batter, as this can lead to a denser cake.

How can I tell if the cake is fully baked?

Insert a toothpick or a knife into the center of the cake; if it comes out clean or with a few crumbs (not wet batter), the cake is done. If it comes out wet, bake for a few more minutes.

What’s the best way to cool the cake?

After baking, let the cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Then, carefully run a knife along the edges to loosen it, and transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely. This helps prevent sogginess.

Can I add flavors to the batter?

Absolutely! You can add spices like cinnamon or nutmeg, or incorporate lemon zest or cocoa powder for different flavors. Just keep the overall balance of dry and wet ingredients in mind.

What’s the best way to store leftover cake?

Store the cake in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days or in the refrigerator for up to a week. You can also freeze slices wrapped in plastic wrap for up to 3 months.

How do I slice the cake neatly?

Use a sharp knife and dip it in warm water for a cleaner cut. Wipe the knife between cuts to maintain neat edges.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This Sugar-Free Sponge Cake is suitable for those following a low-sugar or ketogenic diet due to its use of almond flour and sugar-free ingredients. It is gluten-free, making it a good option for those with gluten sensitivities. If you're catering to a dairy-free audience, you can substitute the butter with coconut oil or a dairy-free margarine and use a plant-based whipped cream for serving. Additionally, consider using a sugar substitute like stevia or monk fruit in place of the applesauce for further sugar reduction, while ensuring the moisture balance of the cake is maintained.

Pairings

This Sugar-Free Sponge Cake pairs wonderfully with fresh berries, such as strawberries, blueberries, or raspberries, which enhance the natural sweetness of the cake. For a richer experience, consider serving it with a dollop of unsweetened whipped cream or a light cream cheese frosting sweetened with a sugar substitute. A light dusting of powdered erythritol can also add a touch of sweetness without the calories. For beverages, a cup of herbal tea or a sparkling water with a splash of lemon can complement the flavors beautifully.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Sugar-Free Sponge Cake at room temperature or slightly chilled for the best texture and flavor. For an elegant presentation, slice the cake into thin layers and stack them with layers of whipped cream and fresh fruit in between. You can also serve it as individual servings with a small portion of whipped cream and a sprinkle of nuts or seeds on top for added crunch. For a festive touch, consider garnishing with mint leaves or edible flowers, which can elevate the visual appeal of the dessert.

Sugar-Free Sponge Cake

45 min
$8
120 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 8

Allergens:

Dietary Tags:

Dessert

Tags:

DessertBakingHealthy

Description

A light and fluffy sponge cake made without sugar, perfect for a guilt-free dessert!

Ingredients

  • eggs: 4
  • baking powder: 1 teaspoon
  • almond flour: 1 cup
  • unsweetened applesauce: 1/2 cup
  • vanilla extract: 1 teaspoon
  • salt: 1/4 teaspoon
  • butter (melted): 2 tablespoons
